definition: to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage

sentences.chinese: 玛丽从人群中推推搡搡地挤过去。

sentences.english: People were pushing and shoving toward the train.
sentences.chinese: 人们推推搡搡挤向火车。

sentences.english: She barged her way through a crowd.
sentences.chinese: 她推推搡搡地穿过人群。

sentences.english: Everybody was pushing and shoving towards the exit.
sentences.chinese: 大家都在推推搡搡向出口挤去。

sentences.english: Gone are the sweaty officials and greasy baggage handlers of yore, the taxi touts and shoving crowds.
sentences.chinese: 官方顾客和昔日推推搡搡的人群处理油腻行李。

sentences.english: The youths jostled (against) an old lady on the pavement.
sentences.chinese: 那些青年人在人行道上推推搡搡挤著了一个老太太。

sentences.english: He had no choice but to jam his way through the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他别无选择，只得推推搡搡挤出人群。

sentences.english: Some even resort to physical abuse, like spitting, shoving, or punching.
sentences.chinese: 有些人甚至开始用起手来，互相吐唾沫，推推搡搡。

sentences.english: They do not push. They wait in line.
sentences.chinese: 他们不推推搡搡，安静排队。

sentences.english: Disallow to do the mean action at school.
sentences.chinese: 在学校不允许做下流动作，推推搡搡。

sentences.english: People huddled one another into the hall.
sentences.chinese: 人们推推搡搡地拥进了大厅。

sentences.english: The bell rang out, and everyone stood up together and jostled toward the door.
sentences.chinese: 钟声响了，大家全都站起身，推推搡搡地朝门口走去。

definition: to tug at/to pull at sb aggressively/to take sb's hand or arm in a too familiar way/(derog.) to hobnob/to consort
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
to fight together/to come to blows
to mediate in a quarrel/to intervene in a dispute and try to calm things down
to try to stop a fight/to intervene in a fight
to shout and quarrel/to make a big fuss
noisy and in disarray/in an uproar
